msbt.message: Chores are boring and repetitive, but when I'm busy scrubbing away around my home, it's almost like a break. For a little while, I can get something accomplished without having to worry about anything.

I've always dreamed about living inside a library… I picture myself surrounded by shelf after shelf of books, stacked up to the ceiling! In a home like that, it's possible I'd never run out reading material!

Recently, I spotted an envelope on the ground. I thought that there might've been a love letter inside, but it wasn't addressed to or from anyone. I peeked inside, and the envelope turned out to be empty!

Yesterday I wore myself out, so I decided to sleep in and spend the whole morning lying around in bed. But I still woke up at the usual time today, like I just couldn't wait to wear myself out all over again.
If I wanted to write up my work history, like for a resume, what could I even say I was good at? Who'd want to hire someone with experience in baking and reading? Are there cookbook researchers?
I was out for a walk on the beach just now when I remembered a funny thing you said once, and it made me smile all over again. I thought you should know that, so that's why I sent you this note.
What are you up to right now? Something fun, I bet. You always have the greatest ideas. So I was thinking of you, and I guess I'm writing to ask if we can plan to do something together soon...

OK, so this might sound strange, but whenever I see numbers lining up, I get excited. Like, if I happen to look at my clock just as the time flips over to 11:11, I feel like that might be important, somehow...

Sometimes I like just being alone, but there is such a thing as too much of a good thing. Eventually the quiet gets to me, and I need some company. That was a hint, by the way, in case you didn't notice...
I've been told so many times that I "take things too seriously," so I'm gonna really try to loosen up. From now on, I'm going to be more spontaneous, less stuck on rules and recipes. I'm serious! Oh…
